item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "At times one remains faithful to a cause only because its opponents do not cease to be insipid." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Ella add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Ella add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Dead. Never been that before. Not even once." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Don't ever call me mad, Mycroft. I'm not mad. I'm just ... well, differently moraled, that's all." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Growth purely for its own sake is the philosophy of cancer." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If it's a chimera alert, we just follows the screams. " -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description:
"Good. Item seven. The <i>had had</i> and <i>that that</i> problem. Lady Cavendish, weren’t you working on this?’
Lady Cavendish stood up and gathered her thoughts. ‘Indeed. The uses of <i>had had</i> and <i>that that</i> have to be strictly controlled; they can interrupt the imaginotransference quite dramatically, causing readers to go back over the sentence in confusion, something we try to avoid.’
‘Go on.’
‘It’s mostly an unlicensed-usage problem. At the last count David Copperfield alone had had <i>had had</i> sixty three times, all but ten unapproved. Pilgrim’s Progress may also be a problem due to its <i>had had/that that</i> ratio.’
‘So what’s the problem in Progress?’
‘That that had <i>that that</i> ten times but had had <i>had had</i> only thrice. Increased <i>had had</i> usage had had to be overlooked, but not if the number exceeds that <i>that that</i> usage.’
‘Hmm,’ said the Bellman, ‘I thought <i>had had</i> had had TGC’s approval for use in Dickens? What’s the problem?’
‘Take the first <i>had had</i> and <i>that that</i> in the book by way of example,’ said Lady Cavendish. ‘You would have thought that that first <i>had had</i> had had good occasion to be seen as <i>had</i>, had you not? <i>Had</i> had had approval but <i>had had</i> had not; equally it is true to say that that <i>that that</i> had had approval but that that other <i>that that</i> had not.’
‘So the problem with that other <i>that that</i> was that…?’
‘That that other-other <i>that that</i> had had approval.’
‘Okay’ said the Bellman, whose head was in danger of falling apart like a chocolate orange, ‘let me get this straight: David Copperfield, unlike Pilgrim’s Progress, had had <i>had</i>, had had <i>had had</i>. <i>Had had</i> had had TGC’s approval?’
There was a very long pause. ‘Right,’ said the Bellman with a sigh, ‘that’s it for the moment. I’ll be giving out assignments in ten minutes. Session’s over – and let’s be careful out there." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If you expect me to believe that a lawyer wrote A Midsummer Night's Dream, I must be dafter than I look." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Literary detection and firearms don't really go hand in hand; pen mighter than the sword and so forth. " -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "I got Oedipus off the incest charge--technicality, of course--he didn't know it was his mother at the time. " -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Death doesn't care about personalities - he's more interested in meeting quotas." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Palindrome as well. My sister's name is Hannah. Father liked word games. He was fourteen times World Scrabble Champion. When he died, we buried him at Queenzieburn to make use of the triple word score." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "I have the death sentence in seven genres." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Who do readers expect to see when they pick up this book? Who has won the Most Troubled Romantic Lead at the BookWorld Awards seventy-seven times in a row? Me. All me." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Sometimes I don't know whether I'm thening or nowing." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ella add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde
